headline: Project Manager at Blueprint
summary:
I've been involved in various community projects leading groups of 20+ volunteers to produce conferences such as TEDxUTSC and community walks led by Grade 9's and 12's across 5 TDSB schools at Jane's Walk. As a project manager at Qaribou, a tech start-up, I manage projects and relationships with clients. I facilitate workshops and the Jane's Walk tech account. 

I'm continually intrigued by how design influences the spaces we live in and how our perception changes depending on our positionality. I'm currently on the lookout for my next community project.

experiences.title: Facilitator
experiences.description: Facilitated workshops and dialogue about city issues including Arts and Mobility in the City to high school youth. Help students create 3-D models of how they want to see their streets like.

experiences.title: Facilitator
experiences.description: I am involved in the public engagement and design research for the Sidewalk Toronto project and its 307 site. I am involved in user research through a number of methods including observation, interviews and interactions with the public as they engage with our urban prototypes at the 307 site. Additionally responsible for the synthesizing and analysis of the resulting feedback and data into themes that inform the team's iterative design process. I report directly to the Design Director and Programming Lead.

experiences.title: Project Manager
experiences.description: Qaribou is a tech firm providing human-centered software. I creating proposal and reports, ensuring timelines are met. I facilitate workshops and the Jane's Walk tech account.

experiences.title: Jane100 Coordinator
experiences.description: Convening Toronto city builders to organize Jane100 workshops . Scheduling monthly meetings to discuss and execute Jane Jacobs centenary year celebrations. Liased between teams across outreach, fundraising and website development. www.jane100.com

experiences.title: Volunteer
experiences.description: Conducted 100 in-person interviews with Thompson Memorial Park users to capture local opinion on Scarborough. Transcribed 50 previously recorded interviews that looked at their Canadian new-comer experience whilst being conscientious of how to store the information and ensure as little of it is being lost through time. Provided logistical support by creating schedules for 50 volunteers to facilitate day-to-day museum tasks.

experiences.company: Geography and City Studies Student Association [GCSA]
experiences.title: Vice President of Communications
experiences.description: Managed social media platforms including Twitter, Facebook, blog and organized events to get students involved with the Geography program at the University of Toronto Scarborough campus. Critiqued and edited current brochure and implemented a plan to improve it.

experiences.title: Global Cities Coordinator
experiences.description: Organizing and facilitating Jane's Walk City Organizer workshops, coordinating travel and accommodation logistics. Collecting feedback from community workshops and organizations about better practices

experiences.title: School Edition Coordinator
experiences.description: Supported the production of student-led environmental walks in 5 TDSB schools and discussion by communicating with project partners, stakeholders, teachers, the public, School Edition Lead and Jane’s Walk Project Office to update different actors about the development of the School Edition pilot project.

experiences.title: Research Supervisor [Department of Human Geography]
experiences.description: Coordinating geodatabases and payment schedules, led multiple projects between teams of ten to collect data to inform city issues in Toronto. Designed and produced a map showing cuisine in Scarborough.

experiences.title: Research Supervisor [Geography and Planning Department]
experiences.description: Interviewed 200+ TTC bus users at bus stops along Finch and Sheppard corridors to get a sense of what walking conditions were like. Provided ongoing quantitative feedback and updates to ensure consistency within groups.

experiences.title: Student of Spaces of Multiraciality: Critical Mixed Race Theory
experiences.description: Alongside with 20 students, we produced an artistic representation showcasing the intersectionality between law, labour, land and language to discuss the problematic representations of people with a mixed race identity. It was selected to be showcased at the Multidisciplinary.Intersectional.Xchanging.Empowering.Dialogues [M.I.X.E.D] Art Gallery.

experiences.title: Research Assistant [Department of Human Geography]
experiences.description:
Working with a team of ten students, used ArcGIS, Google Maps and Excel to evaluate walkability, food distribution, building height and land use in Toronto leading to a publication, 'Choices for Scarborough'.

Led projects that evaluated walkability, food distribution, building height and land use in Toronto. Created geodatabases, split layer files and trained ten students in using ArcGIS whilst continually monitoring project progress. Produced data which was used in the Choices for Scarborough report which was a report on transit, walking and intensification in Toronto's Inner Suburbs.

experiences.title: Director of Productions & Assoicate
experiences.description: Interacted with speakers, performers, host, university faculty to organize stage and production logistics for the TEDxUTSC conference which brings in 300 people yearly and over 5000 via livestream. I've hired and trained 23 volunteers and worked with them to create promotional events. Created minute-to-minute schedules for the day of the conference.
